meanings.def: later than something; following something in time
examples: We'll leave after lunch.
They arrived shortly after 5.
Not long after that he resigned.
Let’s meet the day after tomorrow/the week after next.
After winning the prize she became famous overnight.
After an hour I went home (= when an hour had passed).
(North American English) It’s ten after seven in the morning (= 7.10 a.m.).

meanings.def: next to and following somebody/something in order or importance
examples: Your name comes after mine in the list.
He's the tallest, after Richard.
After you (= Please go first).
After you with the paper (= Can I have it next?).

meanings.def: behind somebody when they have left; following somebody
examples: Shut the door after you.
I'm always having to clean up after the children (= clean the place after they have left it dirty and untidy).
He ran after her with the book.
She was left staring after him.
It was pleasantly cool in the house after the sticky heat outside.

meanings.def: as a result of or because of something that has happened
examples: I'll never forgive him after what he said.

meanings.def: despite something; although something has happened
examples: I can't believe she'd do that, not after all I've done for her.

meanings.def: used to show that something happens many times or continuously
examples: day after day of hot weather
I've told you time after time not to do that.

meanings.def: trying to find or catch somebody/something
examples: The police are after him.
He's after a job at our place.
She asked after you (= how you were).

meanings.def: in the style of somebody/something; following the example of somebody/something
examples: a painting after Goya
We named the baby Ena after her grandmother.

meanings.def: happening or done later than the time or event mentioned
examples: after-hours drinking (= after closing time)
an after-school club
after-dinner mints

meanings.def: despite what has been said or expected
examples: So you made it after all!

meanings.def: used when you are explaining something, or giving a reason
examples: He should have paid. He suggested it, after all.

meanings.def: to be going to do something soon; to be intending to do something soon

idioms.def: despite what has been said or expected
examples: So you made it after all!
He should have paid. He suggested it, after all.

idioms.def: to be going to do something soon; to be intending to do something soon

meanings.def: at a time later than something; when something has finished
examples: I'll call you after I've spoken to them.
Several years after they'd split up they met again by chance in Paris.
That was in 1996. Soon after, I heard that he'd died.
I could come next week, or the week after.
And they all lived happily ever after.
in after years
